comment.body: I'm a bit confused about what's going on here. Are the set variables cleankeypair, cleanenc, cleandec ever used? If so I missed it. And you're updating the scheme['metadata'] data structure here in the template? Shouldn't that logic be back in the Python file that created that data structure in the first place?

pull_request.title: Enable automated upstream imports
pull_request.body:
This is adding capabilities to `copy_from_pqclean` to alternatively automatically import upstream code bases.

This PR is an "empty" run (without actual upstream additions) to ease review. When approved, it will be used to import new upstream versions of `kyber` and `dilithium` (setting the corresponding environment variables listed in the `copy_from_pqclean.yml` file to the folders of the upstream repositories along the same lines as is done for a `PQClean` import). 

But by no means this facility is restricted to those algorithms. The basic idea is to have `META.yml` files modelled on the ones used by `PQClean` within the upstream repositories: These contain 
- names of files to import
- possible compile directives
- possibly changed & properly namespace'd algorithm entry points  
- possibly changed KATs. Any such KAT changes will be called out when running the new script variant to ensure library version bumps can be initiated.

A more complete documentation of this will be added to [the Wiki](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/wiki/Contributing-guide) when merged. Conceptually, this could be used to automatically introduce any new/changed algorithms provided the upstream code maintainer provides NIST-like APIs and these ".yml-import-drivers".

CCI [ran successfully here](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/baentsch/liboqs/307/workflows/742d5394-1bd1-4acd-b89a-78e365753c40)

All files changed outside of `copy_from_pqclean` have the facility added to provide their own compile directives and to allow for their own versions of otherwise common includes (generated by new `copy_from_pqclean`).

A minor correction is also done to `scripts/copy_from_pqclean/src/sig/sig.h/algs_length.fragment` to cater for the new number of algorithms not imported from PQClean.

comment.body: I assume this change is because you want to let other non-PQClean implementations use the PQClean symmetric crypto API?

pull_request.body:

Conceptually, this could be used to automatically introduce any new/changed algorithms provided the upstream code maintainer provides NIST-like APIs and these ".yml-import-drivers".

comment.body: The variables indeed are never used: The purpose of the `set` statement is only to trigger the side-effect of setting the scheme-array-based 'variables' ("default_keypair_signature" in this example) as those 'variables' are needed in later template fields (beyond the reach of jinja's normal, [limited scoping rules](https://jinja.palletsprojects.com/en/2.11.x/templates/)). I also left this code intentionally in this place to ease readability as to what the logic flow is (based on presence/absence of specific `impl` fields). Looks like I failed :-(

comment.body: Yes. But that's not new: I just changed the include order such as to allow non-PQClean code to override 'common' (PQClean) files with its own implementation(s).
